data.title: Federal Agencies Can Procure Paessler's PRTG Network Monitor Through the U.S. General Services Administration's IT Schedule 70
data.meta_description: Federal Agencies Can Procure Paessler's PRTG Network Monitor Through the U.S. General Services Administration's IT Schedule 70 Paessler's PRTG Network Monitor, as well as Related Services, are Listed on its Partner's IT Schedule 70 Contract; it's Never Been Easier for…
data.text:
WAKEFIELD, Mass. and NUREMBERG, Germany, Oct. 30, 2018 /PRNewswire/ — Paessler AG, the innovative network monitoring specialist, today announced that PRTG Network Monitor is now available to federal agencies through its partner’s IT Schedule 70 contract: SYNNEX Corporation’s contract, GS-35F-0143R, includes products and services from more than 200 technology providers able to help agencies effectively manage their information technology (IT).

Used by more than 200,000 system administrators worldwide, PRTG is the world’s most popular network monitoring solution. Intuitive and exceptionally flexible, PRTG enables administrators to see in real-time what is happening across their entire IT infrastructure – including networks, systems, hardware, software and the devices that tie into it.

Highly customizable dashboards make it easy to pinpoint the information that matters most, while alerts delivered in the format the user prefers, including text and SMS, ensure that IT is always the first to know if any pre-determined performance thresholds of its choosing are met, such as those for disk capacity levels, CPU usage, temperature, read-write speeds, etc.

Paessler also provides more than 200 pre-configured, purpose-built sensors – including ones that are tailor made for offerings from well-known providers like Amazon, Cisco, Dell, Fujitsu, Google, Microsoft, NetApp, Oracle, VMware and others. Custom sensors are also easily integrated with PRTG, allowing organizations to embrace transformative trends like the internet of things with confidence and the knowledge that they will be the first to know if any problems arise.

PRTG is broadly applicable to federal agencies and can be used by any teams that are overseeing critical IT infrastructure. This includes those who oversee networks for business operations, operate and maintain video surveillance systems, and make sure headquarters and branch offices enjoy flawless communication with one another.

“The first step to ensure the 100 percent uptime of critical infrastructure is to have visibility over it,” said Andrew Cutting, director of channel sales for North America at Paessler. “We look forward to empowering federal agencies to address any issues that arise in their networks before they become a problem – and in the event something fails, have the insights in front of them they need to determine the root cause and a fix with unprecedented speed.”

Follow Paessler on social media: Facebook, Twitter, Google+ and LinkedIn

About Paessler AG

Paessler AG’s award winning PRTG Network Monitor is a powerful, affordable and easy-to-use Unified Monitoring solution. It is a highly flexible and generic software for monitoring IT infrastructure, already in use at enterprises and organizations of all sizes and industries. Over 200,000 IT administrators in more than 170 countries rely on PRTG and gain peace of mind, confidence and convenience. Founded in 1997 and based in Nuremberg, Germany, Paessler AG remains a privately held company that is recognized as both a member of the Cisco Solution Partner Program and a VMware Technology Alliance Partner.

Learn more about Paessler and PRTG at www.paessler.com.

SOURCE Paessler AG
